## Biography

I am a second-year PhD student in **Biostatistics** at **Columbia University**, advised by Dr. [Tian Gu](https://www.gutian.info/).

Prior to joining Columbia, I received my Bachelor's degree in **Mathematics and Applied Mathematics** at **Shanghai Jiao Tong University**, advised by Dr. [Lin Liu](https://linliu-stats.github.io/).

My research interests lie at the intersection of **Knowledge Transfer**, **Adaptive Data Fusion**, and **Generative Modeling**, with applications to high-dimensional biomedical data and electronic health records (EHR). 

Please feel free to reach out via email for collaboration!

:::

:::

<br>


## Research Interests

I focus on developing robust statistical learning and adaptive machine learning methodologies to improve the model generalizability and reliability of clinical decision support, advancing precision diagnosis and individualized treatment effects:

* **Transfer Learning & Domain Adaptation** for risk prediction and time-to-event outcomes;
* **Online Learning** for real-time model updatings;
* **Diffusion Models** for high-fidelity, privacy-preserving longitudinal EHR generation;
* **Robust Optimization** for multi-domain individualized treatment effects (ITE).
